name: Metagenomics
tagline: Software related to Metagenomics, Bioinformatics, and Statistical methods & publications.
body:
### Detecting Bacterial Genomes in a Metagenomic Sample Using NGS Reads.
The paper proposes a system for detecting the presence of strains of bacteria in metagenomic samples generated using whole-genome hight-throughput DNA sequencing, or Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS).

We use a nucleotide flipping technique on whole genome next generation sequencing (NGS) data to test for the pres- ence of various bacterial strains in a single metagenomic sample.  We introduce artificial point mutations on the NGS reads at the nucleotide level to define a test statistic for each genome in bacterial reference database; we also use a variant of the Westfall-Young procedure to correct for multiple comparisons.

You can obtain a copy of the source code by:

```
$ cd your_computer/your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git clone https://github.com/camilo-v/Metagenomics.git
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

### Requirements

The software was developed on OS X (10.9) and covers four (4) programming languages:

- Python (2.7 variant)
- Perl (perl 5, v.16 or above)
- R (3.1 or above)
- Bash Shell

You will need a reasonably modern computer and operating system that can support all four.

#### Bowtie2

[Bowtie2](http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/index.shtml) is required for the alignment step.  See the Bowtie2 [Getting Started](http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/manual.shtml#getting-started-with-bowtie-2-lambda-phage-example) guide for instructions on installing and running Bowtie2.

#### Samtools

[Samtools](http://www.htslib.org/) is required for parsing the alignments and generating miscellaneous alignment statistics.  See the [Samtools Documentation](http://www.htslib.org/doc/) for instructions on installing and running Samtools.
